/wiki/Tennis_at_the_2003_Pan_American_Ga: Tennis at the 2003 Pan American Games was played at the Centro Nacional de Tenis.
/wiki/Handball_at_the_2003_Pan_American_:
The Handball Tournament at the 2003 Pan American Games took place at Handball Hall in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. There was two competitions with one each for each gender. Cuba was the defending champion in the men's while Brazil were the defending champion in the women.
 The tournament took place between August 2 to 11 with the winning sides of both the men’s and women’s tournament will directly qualify for the 2004 Olympic Handball Tournaments. That nation would be Brazil who would win both tournaments over Argentina.
/wiki/Weightlifting_at_the_2003_Pan_Amer: This page shows the results of the Weightlifting Competition at the 2003 Pan American Games, held from August 12 to August 16, 2003 in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. There were a total number of fifteen medal events, eight for men and seven for women.
/wiki/Football_at_the_2003_Pan_American_: Football at the 2003 Pan American Games may refer to:
/wiki/Table_tennis_at_the_2003_Pan_Ameri: Table tennis competitions at the 2003 Pan American Games in Santo Domingo were held in August 7 to 13, 2003 at the Table tennis center. The winners of the tournament secured a place at the 2004 Summer Olympics.
/wiki/Gymnastics_at_the_2003_Pan_America: This page shows the results of the Gymnastics Competition at the 2003 Pan American Games, held from August 2 to August 5 in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic.
/wiki/Field_hockey_at_the_2003_Pan_Ameri: The field hockey tournament at the 2003 Pan American Games was held in the Santo Domingo Stadium, Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic  from August 1–17, 2003. It served as a qualification tournament for the 2004 Summer Olympics in Athens, Greece. First place received a ticket for the Olympic tournament. The men competed for the tenth time at the Pan Americans, the women for the fifth time.
/wiki/Archery_at_the_2003_Pan_American_G: This page shows the results of the Archery Competition at the 2003 Pan American Games, held from August 1 to August 17, 2003 in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic.
/wiki/Venues_of_the_2003_Pan_American_Ga:
The 2003 Pan American Games were held in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic and surrounding area. The Pan American Games  ran from in July and August 2003.
 This is a list of competition venues that were used during the games. 34 Venues will be used, with a majority of them being built for the games.
